meanings.def: connected with the practical use of machines, methods, etc. in science and industry
examples: We offer free technical support for those buying our software.
The organization provides technical assistance to farmers.
technical drawing (= especially taught as a school subject)
This is a purely technical issue.

meanings.def: connected with the skills needed for a particular job, sport, art, etc.
examples: She doesn't possess the technical ability to perform the song well.
Skaters score extra points for technical complexity.

meanings.def: connected with a particular subject and therefore difficult to understand if you do not know about that subject
examples: A lot of the discussions were highly technical.
The article is full of technical terms.
The guide is too technical for a non-specialist.
The conversation was getting a bit technical for me, so I left them to it.
Without getting too technical, this is basically how it works.

meanings.def: connected with the details of a law or set of rules
examples: Their lawyers spent days arguing over technical details.
